intro: Scleria acanthocarpa, commonly known as the spiky sedges, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and distinctive, spiky inflorescences. Scleria acanthocarpa typically grows in wet or marshy areas, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it an important component of wetland ecosystems.
